column4: I am wondering about being able to pass arguments to commands with keyboard shortcuts
the alt+prsc calls -w not -a
what is it doing wrong? it should work as expected and run the command with whatever arguments you specified
It just runs the command as if there were no arguments
it seems to work for me, where are you setting this shortcut?

do you mean the command or the shortcut. I created a shortcut in system > preferences > keyboard shortcuts to run gnome-screenshot -a which works from the terminal correctly, however the shortcut runs seemingly without the argument
it seems to work for me for whatever reason
what version are you running?
and working on both?
any ideas as to how I could track down the source of my problem?
perhaps it would be easier for me to ask which you're using
they already have, several times

rohith sorry mentioned that earlier. I am running 10.10 here and trying to setup a keyboard shortcut to call "gnome-screenshot -a" without the quotes in the command. When I press the keys it seems to just call "gnome-screenshot"
so it takes a screenshot of the whole screen anyway?
precisely
it works for me unless my 10.10 is different somehow, do you have visual effects enabled or disabled?
not sure, how can I check. I should probably mention that when I run from terminal everything runs fine
in system, preferences, appearance, visual effects

was on normal, I changed to extra with no change in result? Do I have to set the command with quotes or anything in the keyboard shortcut? I tried single and double quotes both of which failed to execute entirely
no quotes, i'm just trying to set something up with the same settings to see if i get the same issue
thanks, I have a pretty default setup here didn't customize all that much
as a workaround, you could probably make a tiny script that would run it with the correct arguments
thanks that is actually a nice idea, I am going to run with that
